alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Idaho, southeastern Mineral, south central Lake, southwestern Missoula, southeastern Sanders and northwestern Ravalli Counties through 500 PM MDT/400 PM PDT/... At 413 PM MDT/313 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms extending from 6 miles north of Frenchtown to 7 miles southwest of Florence. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar. Public reports. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Stevensville, Alberton, Wye, Florence, Frenchtown, Arlee, Evaro, Ninemile and Huson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 73 and 101. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 9, and near mile marker 16. Highway 93 S between mile markers 63 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
